TopicTitle: How many people have an account on the bug tracker for upvoting/downvoting?

Articles.Content:
Hello fellow KSPers,

Squad have indicated that upvoting/downvoting is an important part of indicating to them that a bug is important to us for fixing

However...how many of us actually have an account? or use it regularly?

Edited April 25, 2020 by Anth12

I had one a few years ago...
But after not being able to get into it any moar even tho i put in my correct id/password, and Squad seemingly ignoring most of the items I was most concerned with, I gave up on it

I have one and use it to up vote issues that affect me or are obviously important.

I don't up vote just because someone else wants a lot of votes on their pet issue, and don't ask for up cores on my own pet issues.

@Superfluous J People dont have to vote on anything if they dont want to.

Squad keep pointing us to the voting system within the bug tracker like its important.

That if people are concerned enough that if they upvote then Squad will do something.

I might take a look at the current highest upvoted bugs and see what squad have done about them

We dont know many people can vote if they wanted to...

Also note that while rating is a factor in Squad's bug fixing, it's not the only factor. The bug must also be able to be recreated consistently, and someone has to figure out how to fix it. The clarity of the report and the quality of any attachments helps far more than a "me too" upvote.
Well my last one is kind of to the point, but I had to add and remove some things after I posted it due to my graphs not having x and y axes.
I just believe in their programmers. Vote on not, they will have done first what has worked out first.

Lets see what happens on the next release.

QA have been assigned to a lot of bugs in the last few releases which is different behavior to what it was a few years ago
